title: I've recently noticed that people get extremely mad at me whenever I tell them the truth, how can I fix this? - Quora

response.answer_text: Sometimes people use being “honest” as an excuse for saying hurtful things. People tend to confuse being rude and being honest. For example…”you got so fat!” Well, he DID get fat…you were just “being honest.” Or, say a friend causes a major catastrophe at work. She asks, “did I cause the downfall of the company?” You could be honest, she did ask for your opinion, after all, although she might not like the answer. However, if you walked up to her saying, “what’d you do? You singlehandedly caused the downfall of the company!” You were still being honest, but she did not ask for your opinion! If you don’t want people to be mad at you, then tell them what they want to hear. If you want to be a true friend, tell them the truth, but ONLY if they asked.
